description: From Latin praecox (“premature, precocious, ripe before time, early ripe”), from praecoquere (“to ripen beforehand, ripen fully, also boil beforehand”), from prae (“before”) + coquere (“to cook, boil, ripen”).

adjectives.description: precocious (comparative more precocious, superlative most precocious)

entries.meaning: Characterized by exceptionally early development or maturity.
examples: The precocious plant was already blooming flowers by day 4.

entries.meaning: Exhibiting advanced skills and aptitudes at an abnormally early age.
examples: The precocious child began reading the newspaper at age four.
